bibl.title: 'They Shall Speak the Arabic Language and Take Pride in it': Reconsidering the Fate of Coptic after the Arab Conquest.
bibl.note: [Introduction.] - Pseudo-Samuel's argument. - Literary context and date. - Alexandria and Cairo, tradition and innovation, Coptic and Arabic. - Evaluating the linguistic situation in the tenth century. - Conclusion. - The complaints on the adoption of Arabic by the Copts in the Apocalypse of Pseudo-Samuel should be inserted in the context of a rift within the medieval Coptic church over the question of language choice, and beyond this, over that of accomodation with the Muslims.
bibl.seg: PAPACONSTANTINOU Arietta, 'They Shall Speak the Arabic Language and Take Pride in it': Reconsidering the Fate of Coptic after the Arab Conquest.
